title: Master's Thesis: Out-of-distribution Detection with Energy-based Models. (arXiv:2302.12002v2 [cs.LG] UPDATED)
abstract: Today, deep learning is increasingly applied in security-critical situations such as autonomous driving and medical diagnosis. Despite its success, the behavior and robustness of deep networks are not fully understood yet, posing a significant risk. In particular, researchers recently found that neural networks are overly confident in their predictions, even on data they have never seen before. To tackle this issue, one can differentiate two approaches in the literature. translated_abstract: 如今，深度学习在自动驾驶和医学诊断等安全关键场景中得到越来越广泛的应用。尽管其取得了成功，深度网络的行为和鲁棒性仍未被完全理解，存在着极大的风险。近期研究人员发现，神经网络对于从未见过的数据也过度自信。为了解决这个问题，文献中区分了两种方法。一种方法在预测中考虑不确定性，而第二种方法则估计训练数据的潜在密度，以决定给定的输入是否接近训练数据，从而使网络能够按预期执行。在本文中，我们研究了EBM在拟合训练数据分布以执行越界检测任务方面的能力。我们发现，在大多数数据集上，EBM并没有本质上优于其他密度估计器来检测OOD数据，即便是使用先进的训练方法。
tldr: 本文研究了基于能量模型的越界检测能力，并发现其在大多数数据集上表现并不优于其他密度估计器。
en_tdlr: This thesis investigates the out-of-distribution detection capability of energy-based models(EBMs) and finds that they do not inherently outperform other density estimators on most datasets.
